page.title: 14HOLYWELL'S EMPLOYMENT
page.content: {Service industries}associated with retailing and local government offer the main employment opportunities in the Holywell area. The town was once a market town serving the agricultural hinterland. Small-scale{manufacturing is represented by the old-established woollen mill and Hall's soft-drinks factory situated in the Greenfield Valley. The impending closure of the Courtaulds textile mill at Greenfield indicates the decline of major manufacturing,this will increase the {unemployment}rate of 18%. Holywell has become a{dormitory town}with many people travelling to work outside the area. Among employers are the Vauxhall car plant at Ellesmere Port, British Aerospace at Broughton and small-scale manufacturing units being established along the coastal strip since the closure of steel making at Shotton.
